course_title: Essentials of Chinese Language in Social Life

learning_outcomes.description: Analyse the form, meaning, and function of languages with regard to their contexts in everyday life, including workplace interactions.
Develop a comprehensive understanding of the historical development of Chinese languages.
Understand its social and regional variances.
Become a skillful user of languages and an intercultural communicator.
Demonstrate respect for cultural and social diversity and for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and perspectives.
Demonstrate knowledge and respect for ethics and ethical standards in completing assessment tasks.
Lead self and others in group activities.
Be confident dealing with ambiguity and uncertainty.
Present persuasive oral and written arguments.
Be empathetic of other people, cultures, and knowledge systems.

assessments.task_description:
CHIN2600 Video 1: Problem and example  

Purposes: Identify a real-world and language-centered problem. Use the theories or concepts learned in class to explain the problem. Communicate your preliminary findings to others. Prepare you for the final project.   

Due Date: 22 September 2025 at 3:00pm

Weight: 40%

Task Description:

Make a video explaining to others (instructors and students in CHIN2600) how the theories/concepts you have learned from CHIN2600 can be used to explain a problem in your social life. You are highly encouraged to develop this video project into your final project, which will focus on data analysis and proposed solutions.  

Details: You will need to identify a research topic about real-world, language-based problems; explain why it is a problem by including all aspects; justify why the problems are critical by reviewing existing discussions; connect the problems to an aspect of Chinese language discussed in the class; explain which theory or concept taught in class can better explain the problems; collect some “social interactional” data to illustrate the problem (e.g., recordings of social interactions or online discussion); use concepts/theories taught in class to analyse an example from the data; and present your findings.       

Format: You will need to create a video using voice-over-powerpoint (or similar). Zoom recording can support this purpose. You also want to make sure that your face is shown in the video.   

Submission: Upload your video to Blackboard (CHIN2600 Blackboard > Assessment > Video Project > Video Submission). 

What to include in your video:

  1. What is your topic? Why is it an important problem according to the existing discussions in news media, government policy, and AI search? Is the information provided by AI accurate and reliable?    
  2. What theories or concepts taught in the class can be used to better understand the problem? Why are they the best theories or concepts?    
  3. What is your language data? How were they collected?
  4. Use the theories or concepts taught in the class to analyze one illustrative example from the data. 
  5. What did you learn from this project that AI could not provide?   

You should make extensive research on your topic and show your understanding in the presentation with multiple sources. Make your presentation engaging and insightful.

Language: English or Mandarin Chinese

Length: 8 minutes. (Anything after 8 minutes will not be viewed or marked).

Conference participation: You will need to attend a group conference organized by your instructor to demonstrate your understanding of the assignment, update your progress on the project, and receive feedback on your project.  

Assessment criteria:

  • Demonstrate understanding of theories or concepts discussed in the class and be able to use them to explain a real-world and language-based problem in social life
  • Clear, coherent expression, engaging communication style
  • Effective use of visuals/multimedia/Powerpoint
  • Participate in a group conference 
  • Check the rubric for more details

STATEMENT ON GENERATIVE AI & MT

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

assessments.task_description:
CHIN2600 Video 2: Analysis and solution    

Purpose: Synthesize your learning, both theoretical and practical, and propose solutions to the identified problem.  

Due Date: November 10 2025 at 15:00 pm (Brisbane time)

Weight: 60%

Video length: within 12 minutes  

Description: Make a video analysing social interactional data you have collected from your social life and relating them to a concept and a theory discussed in the class. You will draw on the findings of your analysis to provide solutions to the problem you have identified. You are encouraged to create the video based the problem you have identified in video 1. It is ok if you want to focus on a topic different from your video project.   

What to include:

The video should have the following components: 

  1. an introduction that introduces a real-world and language-based problem and the importance of the problem;
  2. a theoretical section that briefly explains what theories you are using in analysing the data and why they are the best theories for analysing the data. The theories must be from the readings covered in class; 
  3. a data section that briefly explains how the data were collected and selected; 
  4. a data analysis section that presents your analysis with at least three illustrative examples. This is the main part of the video; 
  5. a solution section that presents at least three practical solutions to or suggestions for the identified problem. The solutions or suggestions should be based on the findings of the data analysis. This is also the main part of the video;  
  6. conclusion section that summarizes your findings and reflects on the importance of your findings that AI could not provide; 
  7. a reference list in the end that includes sources you referenced in the paper. In the reference list, provide the URL to your interview/interactional recordings if you use them as your data. 
  • The powerpoint slides should follow APA https://owl.purdue.edu/owl/research_and_citation/apa_style/apa_formatting_and_style_guide/general_format.html
  • Make sure to relate the analysis to the themes, theoretical frameworks, or concepts studied in class. 
  • Your data analysis must include transcripts (interactional data) or texts (screenshots). Transcripts should have Chinese characters. 
  • Upload your slides and video to Blackboard

Assessment criteria: Check Blackboard
